poem:
Title: "In the Vein of Difference"

In the touchstone of history's dawn,
Trump gazed upon the Capitol's discontent,  
In the colors of bodies, he drew a fawn.
 
A simple question Biden paints,
Of color, voice and fiery fates.
Had the black hand led the chaotic dance,
Would the chest of justice pant the same stance?

Scathing mirrors of power, reflect,
Endless alike rivers, conscripted by respect.
